You are given $n$ houses numbered from 1 to $n$. Each house has a plaque with a number on it, representing the number of the house the resident wants to go to next.  

Here are the rules:

*  You can start walking from any house numbered 1 to $k$ inclusive and eventually reach house number 1.
*  You cannot start walking from any house numbered $k+1$ to $n$ inclusive and reach house number 1.
*  If you start walking from house number 1, you can return to house number 1 after some number of steps.

Find the number of ways to assign numbers to the plaques so that these rules are followed.  Print the remainder when this number is divided by $10^9 + 7$.

You have a line of houses numbered 1 to n. Each house has a number on its sign that indicates the number of the next house to visit.  

You need to figure out how many different ways you can number the houses so that:

* Starting from any house 1 to k, you can eventually reach house 1.
* Starting from any house k+1 to n, you can never reach house 1.
* Starting from house 1, you can return to house 1 after walking to other houses. 



Count the number of possible arrangements and find the remainder when divided by 1000000007.
